column4: hey everyone I am looking to set up playing music on my ubuntu box using another computer via wifi.  I thought mpd might be a good solution.  So I was wondering if any of you have any opinions of mpd and if you know of a good web server front ends so that I could play my music via the ubuntu box and via the other computer.
anonymous2, rhythmbox can be a front end to mpd?
anonymous2, I have been doing some research on music player daemon
anonymous2, ok, so how do you go about controlling an ubuntu box via another computer?
Install sshd on the server and set up publickey auth?
sorry bad phrasing: controlling in reference to controlling music
Sure, you can ssh in and use some music server
the problem that I have been having is that I have been having trouble accessing via shell.  Maybe it's the program, but I have no idea how to control rhythmbox via shell.
ew, don't use rhythmbox, use mpd
oh ok, so I am very new to this: is ncpmc a form of mpd or something that goes on top of mpd
mpd is the music server (database of your music etc); ncpmc is the music client (what you as the user interact with - choosing what to play etc)
There are other options, but that's what I'd recommend. Note that ubuntu's default setup for mpd is *not good*, so you will have to tweak it
what isn't so hot about it?

It assumes you want it to be system-wide, which you probably don't. So, for example, it starts mpd on start-up, but pointing at a location that has no music in it (ie the systemwide location) -- whereas you want it to not start at boot time so you can start it when you need it and it will use ~/.mpd/mpd.conf which you will configure correctly to point at your music library
yeah, it takes a bit of getting used to, but it definitely works (and incredibly stable!)
